title: Discussion: Data vs Information
content: Data refers to a raw and unorganized fact that is required to be processed to make it meaningful, such as numbers, text, or images.

title: Discussion: Data vs Information
content: On the other hand, information is data that has been processed and organized in a meaningful way to provide knowledge or insights.

title: Data vs Information
content: For example, imagine a document containing a list of names and ages. The list itself is the data,

title: Data vs Information
content: while a summary report highlighting the average age of the individuals would be the information derived from that data.

title: Now Challenge Yourself!
content: Now it's your turn to become a Data Sorter! Determine whether each file represents data or information,

title: Now Challenge Yourself!
content: and place them in the correct categories.
